text: Brunei competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Brunei entered two swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Muhammad Isa Ahmad |align=left|50 m breaststroke |30.22 |60 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m breaststroke |1:06.51 |74 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Christian Nikles |align=left|50 m freestyle |24.69 |86 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |55.33 |98 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Brunei at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Brunei at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
